column4: anyone use aria2c?  I'm using it to d/l the ubuntu iso and its slowly been climing from 300k/s up to now 830k/s.  Started with just 10 seeds and slowly grew to 70 now(i put max peers at 100 on command line).  Its taken almost 10 minutes to get from 300 to 800, how can i get that to get to the better speeds faster in the future?
with bit torrent in aria2c, btw
where did you find the torrent?
ubuntu.com
http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/alternative-download#bt
i see. what is your internet connection speed?
20Mbit
so it should go up to >2MB, sabnzbd will do 1-2MB/s depending on how happy comcast is
wait, comcast? you know they throttle bittorrent?
but the max speed isn't what i'm so worried about, it annoys me that it climbs so slowly, like its slowly choosing connections
hence why i use sabnzbd
took 10 minutes to go from 10 peers to 80
should take 1 minute
since your ISP throttles bittorrent i suggest you download using the HTTP link instead
when already getting 850k/s ?
yes
your ISP is deliberately doing this to you
awfully silly, comcast with non-parallel http is 100k/s
you have to split the connection to get 2MB/s on http
err, split the download across multiple http connections
try rtorrent and see if you get any different result
